newsitem.title: USA: U.S. 1996 trade deficit grows as Dec deficit widens.
newsitem.headline: U.S. 1996 trade deficit grows as Dec deficit widens.

text.p: The U.S. trade deficit shot up in December on record imports, driving the shortfall on total goods and services trade for all of 1996 to an eight-year peak, the Commerce Department said on Wednesday.

The December deficit climbed 29.6 percent to $10.29 billion from a revised $7.94 billion in November, bringing the total 1996 trade gap to $114.23 billion -- an 8.7 percent jump from 1995 and the highest since a $115.5 billion shortfall in 1988.
